intro: Chrysodium scalpturatum, commonly known as the golden scalpturatum, is a unique flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a compact growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves that are densely packed. Its botanical classification places it within the family Poaceae, making it a type of grass. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
